content: whatever you use it must be stretchy enough to block out the lace go up a needle size if you find your bobble is too tight serenity by rachel booker 3 ©featherbrush designs 2015 all rights reserved finishing sew ends and wet block soak your shawl in a gentle wool wash and pin out flat to dry using wires if you have them the top edge should be pinned straight in the centre give it a really good tug outwards to remove the bump from the cast on the shawl will want to curve around at the ends into a lovely crescent make it yours ideas to change it up 2 colours work stocking stitch section in colour a change yarn and work garter bands and body lace panels in colour b omit stocking stitch and work garter band sections with body lace panels work longer or shorter stocking stitch sections for a subtle change in the look of your shawl add beads to your lace work larger lace sections in the body of the shawl by working body lace from row 1-6 then repeat extended row 1-8
